title: Jennifer Lopez and Scarlett Johansson glow in gold at Governors Awards
text:
The golden girls (Picture: Getty Images, Rex)

You can always rely on Jennifer Lopez and Scarlett Johansson to set the bar on the red carpet but they took it to the next level at this year’s Governors Awards.

The Hollywood stars flocked to the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood on Sunday night to kickstart the Oscars 2020 campaign season, hosted by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

Jennifer, 50, led the glam squad and said it with her chest in a beautiful strapless citron gown courtesy of Reem Acra. With such a bold colour and style, the Love Don’t Cost A Thing singer everything else simple with just a trickle of diamonds adorning her neckline.

Also, loving the (sort of) Princess Leia style braids J.Lo.

Elsewhere on the red carpet, Scarlett, 34, quite literally struck gold in her one-shouldered Celine gown that boasted a backless detail, glittering gold top and a black skirt with a thigh-high split.

The Avengers: Endgame actress was joined on the red carpet by Thor director Taika Waititi but, in that dress, nobody could possibly steal her shine.

Other stars to grace the red carpet included Renee Zellweger, Charlize Theron, Lupita Nyong’o and Robert Pattinson.

Who knew Jennifer could pull off a-line? (Picture: WireImage)

Charlize rocked the monochrome look (Picture: FilmMagic)

Renee Zellweger looked pretty as a petal (Picture: WireImage)

Dakota Johnson looked sensational (Picture: WireImage)

Keke Palmer giving us plunging neckline (Picture: WireImage)

Saoirse Ronan went for a bold look (Picture: WireImage)

Scarlett living her life like it’s golden (Picture: Getty Images)

Olivia Wilde looks beautiful in rich red (Picture: FilmMagic)

It was a particularly special night for Geena Davis, who received an honorary Oscar in light of her stellar 40-year career and philanthropy work. The actress looked overwhelmed with emotion as she accepted the Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award on-stage.

The rest of the honorary Oscars were given out to The Last of the Mohicans actor Wes Studi, filmmaker David Lynch and writer and director Lina Wertmuller.

It’ll be a tight race to the actual Oscars in February, with competition fierce in the top five main categories.

Jennifer Lopez is hotly-tipped to scoop a best actress nomination for her critically-acclaimed role in Hustlers, while Robert Pattinson is earning all kinds of applause for his starring role in horror The Lighthouse.

The Oscars 2020 will take place on Sunday 9 February and the nominations are expected to be announced early next year.
